text:
Trump took Vladimir Putin at his word on Russian election interference.

He took MBS at his word over the brutal murder of Jamal Khashoggi.

And today in Hanoi he took Kim Jong Un at his word over the death of Otto Warmbier.
author: PhilipRucker

text: ‘He tells me he didn't know’: Trump defends Kim Jong Un over death of Otto Warmbier -- the latest from @jdawsey1 in Hanoi https://wapo.st/2TlLYMJ?tid=ss_tw&utm_term=.2700f4abc596 …
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump says he believes Kim Jong Un was not responsible for what happened to Otto Warmbier.

"Those prisons are rough...He tells me that he didn’t know about it and I will take him at his word.”

Echoes of Trump previously taking Vladimir Putin at his word.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump explaining why there's no deal with North Korea: “Sometimes you have to walk, and this was just one of those times.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: Our latest from Hanoi --> Trump and Kim end summit early and fail to reach a deal. Developing story...
author: PhilipRucker

text: Major development in Hanoi -- Trump and Kim's summit has been abruptly cut short with no deal. The White House says no agreement was reached on North Korea's denuclearization.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump sounded more optimistic about talks than Kim, although he kept cautioning that he's in "no rush" to secure North Korea's denuclearization. "Speed is not that important to me," Trump said, adding that he has "great respect" for Kim and his country.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Pooler @DavidNakamura asked Kim Jong Un if he was confident of reaching a deal with Trump. The North Korean leader replied, "It's too early to say. I would not say I'm pessimistic."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Kim Jong Un's security footprint appears bigger than Trump's here in Hanoi. There are more North Korean bodyguards encircling their dictator than the Secret Service entourage that's visible around the US president.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "On 'Hannity,' Trump’s summits are a smashing success" -- good @elianayjohnson read about the Fox personalities who help the White House produce the big show, whether in Hanoi or Singapore or Helsinki

text:
Two Trump legacies were in clear view Wednesday: A bid for history in Hanoi and exposure as an alleged con man, racist and criminal in Washington. A monumental day of presidential opportunity and peril.

text:
Trump is losing the battle for public opinion. New WaPo/ABC poll:

-54 percent oppose the wall, 42 percent support

text:
Trump sent 12 tweets before noon today:
-attacking "Lyin' James Comey"
-claiming he's tougher on Russia than predecessors
-declaring himself alone in the White House
-urging Dems to negotiate
-slamming "a Fake reporter from the Amazon Washington Post"
-insisting there's no chaos
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump just said of government shutdown over border wall, now in third week: “This is not a fight I wanted. I didn’t want this fight.”

Back in December, Trump said on camera, "I am proud to shut down the government for border security."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump also says the "threshold" for declaring a national emergency at the border (empowering him to build the wall without congressional approval) is if he cannot make a deal with Congress, via pooler @rebeccaballhaus
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump again claims federal workers support the shutdown: "You take a look at social media, so many of those people are saying, 'It’s very hard for me, it’s very hard for my family, but, Mr. President, you’re doing the right thing.'” via pooler @rebeccaballhaus
author: PhilipRucker

text: “The Oval Office, which can confer gravitas on a typical president, simply saps this atypical one. Mr. Trump comes alive playing off a crowd...Plopped behind a desk, sniffling, reading sleepily from a TelePrompTer, he was a comedian playing an empty room.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: “As skillful as he is at dominating the national conversation, he has been singularly ineffective in this battle to change public minds or weaken the will of his Democratic opponents” — @danbalz on Trump and the wall

text: Big problem for White House right now: Cracks multiplying in GOP ranks on Capitol Hill over shutdown and Trump’s wall demand.

text: Trump’s scripted remarks contained little new. In many respects, his sedate Oval Office speech was a buttoned-up version of his golden escalator speech 3.5 years ago.
author: PhilipRucker

text:

text:
“You can’t impeach somebody that’s doing a great job, that’s the way I look at it” — Trump says in Rose Garden

This is false. Congress can begin impeachment proceedings if and when it wants, irrespective of what some people think of the president’s job performance.
author: PhilipRucker

text: So much to chew over in Trump’s Rose Garden speech, but I’m stuck on this: He claimed previous presidents have told him they wish they’d built a border wall. Really? Obama? Bush 43? Clinton? Bush 41? Carter? None has signaled in any way that he is pro-wall.
author: PhilipRucker

text:

Sec State: Fired, then said president doesn’t read and wanted to do unlawful things.
Sec Def: Quits citing fundamental disagreement with president about America’s allies and threats.
AG: Resigns under pressure after president calls him mentally retarded, etc.

text: “President Trump pledged in his campaign that he would not be predictable. He’s more than lived up to that promise this week, and along the way, he has made a hash out of the way business is being done in Washington,” @danbalz writes

text: Leon Panetta tells us Jim Mattis’ resignation is a national security risk. “We’re in a constant state of chaos right now in this country...While it may satisfy [Trump’s] need for attention, it’s raising hell with the country.” https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/a-tailspin-under-siege-trump-propels-the-government-and-markets-into-crisis/2018/12/20/e30347e0-046b-11e9-b6a9-0aa5c2fcc9e4_story.html …

text:
NEW —> “A tailspin": Under siege, Trump propels the government and markets into crisis

My latest on the cascade of news with the best of the best @costareports & @jdawsey1

https://wapo.st/2EDenHe
author: PhilipRucker

text: It's hard to overstate the magnitude of Mattis's resignation. The world viewed him as the rock. As crazy as things appeared to be in the Oval, allies took comfort in the fact that Mattis was in charge at the Pentagon. He will be gone Feb. 28.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Just another Thursday
author: PhilipRucker

text: Huge --> Mattis is out
author: PhilipRucker

text: Good @agearan & @jdawsey1 look at Trump’s fraying relationship with Defense Secretary Jim Mattis, once the president’s “central casting” general
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Dem star @RepJeffries was just on MSNBC praising Jared Kushner as an ally on prison reform.

Reminder that at the same time Trump threatens a government shutdown over the wall — an especially polarizing #MAGA priority — he is about to get a big bipartisan win on criminal justice.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Mueller seeks Roger Stone’s testimony to House intelligence panel, suggesting special counsel is near end of probe of Trump adviser. A WaPo scoop via @CarolLeonnig @nakashimae @PostRoz & @RoigFranzia
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Today in court, a federal judge scolded Michael Flynn -- "You sold your country out" -- for working on behalf of Turkey and undermining USA during 2016 campaign.

Today at the White House, Sanders said Trump's positive comments about Flynn were "perfectly acceptable."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Sanders says "rat" is "a pretty appropriate term" for federal cooperating witnesses who "are lying." (Trump called his former personal attorney Michael Cohen a rat.)
author: PhilipRucker

text: "Maybe he did do those things [lying], but it had nothing to do with the president," @PressSec said of Flynn.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump has asked every federal agency to look for money that can be used to build the border wall, @PressSec says
author: PhilipRucker

text: "We know Michael Cohen to be a liar on a number of fronts. The president's opinion is extremely clear on that front." -- @PressSec
author: PhilipRucker

text: "The FBI broke standard protocol in the way that they came in and ambushed General Flynn," @PressSec says after Flynn admitted today in court that he lied to FBI under oath.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "We wish General Flynn well" -- @PressSec
author: PhilipRucker

text: Sanders announces that Trump will attend the World Economic Forum in Davos next month. U.S. delegation will be led by Mnuchin and include Pompeo, Ross, Acosta, Chao, Nielsen, Lighthizer, McMahon, Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner and Chris Liddell.
author: PhilipRucker

text: New York's AG found “a shocking pattern of illegality involving the Trump Foundation — including unlawful coordination with the Trump presidential campaign, repeated and willful self-dealing, and much more.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: White House signals it will back down on President Trump’s demand for border wall funding and avert a partial government shutdown

text:
Not yet 9 am and the president has:
-tweet-raged about Strzok and Page 
-wished Flynn good luck at sentencing
-directed Fed to “feel the market”
-attacked Facebook, Twitter & Google for bias
-complained about immigration
-called for end of Russia probe citing a reporter’s comment

text: Top Republicans struggle to persuade Trump not to shut down the government, @seungminkim @ericawerner & @jdawsey1 report

text: "It undermines the rule of law. This is the president of the United States calling a witness who has just cooperated with the Justice Department 'a rat'... There's a set of values that represent the glue of this country and they are under attack." -- a fiery @Comey just now
author: PhilipRucker

text: News here -- Lamar Alexander, a veteran U.S. senator and former governor of Tennessee, will not seek reelection in 2020.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Rats are everywhere in DC, even at the White House. And I mean real rats — the nasty, long-tailed rodents, not Mueller witnesses.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
How do parents raise boys "at a turbulent time, when the boy next door could be exposed as the next perpetrator of a #MeToo moment or grow into the bully in the C-suite"?

@amyjoyce_berg on the challenges of keeping from raising a jerk
author: PhilipRucker

text: WaPo obtained a report prepared for the Senate that found Russia’s disinformation campaign used every major social media platform to deliver words, images and videos to targeted voters to help elect Donald Trump — and to support him once in office
author: PhilipRucker

text: “At a time when democracies and their basic values are increasingly under attack, the iconic American company has helped raise the stature of authoritarian and corrupt governments across the globe” — big NYT investigation of McKinsey
author: PhilipRucker

text: This has been a dreary, wet — and, for the president, tweet-filled — weekend in Washington
author: PhilipRucker

text: Ryan Zinke resigned under pressure as administration officials concluded he was the most vulnerable Cabinet member to congressional investigations when Dems take over in January, @eilperin & @jdawsey1 report. His tenure was plagued by ethics scandals.

author: PhilipRucker

text: With Zinke out, it’s a good time to reup one of the great stories of the Trump administration — @Reinlwapo on Zinke making aides fly a special flag at Interior when he is “in garrison”
author: PhilipRucker

author: PhilipRucker

author: PhilipRucker

text:
“Stop.”
“I wasn’t there.”
“I don’t know anything about that.”
“Oh, I don’t do interviews on any of that stuff.”
See Republican senators dodge and dismiss @seungminkim’s questions about Trump and his legal woes
author: PhilipRucker

text: So. Much. News. To. Breakdown. As @PeterAlexander & @SheinelleJones note that Pelosi-Schumer Oval clash feels like eons ago!

text:
Frustrated by rejections, Trump abruptly names Mulvaney as WH chief of staff - who may or may not stay permanently

My latest with @jdawsey1 & @damianpaletta

text: Trump evidently is sensitive to the week of public rejections and media narrative that people of stature did not want to be his chief of staff
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump picks Mick Mulvaney as acting chief of staff, capping an extraordinary week-long public search for his third chief of staff in two years. https://wapo.st/2Bjdq2Y
author: PhilipRucker

text: White House officials told us earlier today that Trump felt no pressure to make immediate decision on chief of staff and was trying to be deliberative, even said the search could stretch into the holidays. BUT they warned POTUS could tweet a choice in 10 minutes time. Prescient!
author: PhilipRucker

text: Former Trump chief of staff @Reince Priebus selected to join Navy with backing from Mattis, @DanLamothe reports
author: PhilipRucker

text: “Nothing at the Trump Organization was ever done unless it was run through Mr. Trump. He directed me to make the payments, he directed me to become involved in these matters. He knows the truth. I know the truth. Others know the truth.” — Michael Cohen

My latest with @WPJohnWagner on the Michael Cohen saga

author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump: “Nancy’s in a situation where it’s not easy for her to talk”

Pelosi: “Mr. President, please don’t characterize the strength that I bring to this meeting as the leader of the House Democrats who just won a big victory"

Schumer: “Elections have consequences, Mr. President”
author: PhilipRucker

text: “Unfortunately this has spiraled downward" -- Nancy Pelosi
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Schumer to Trump: “We have a lot of disagreements here. The Washington Post today gave you a whole bunch of Pinocchios…"

He's probably thinking of the big debut of Bottomless Pinnochios

text:
Two years ago, Rex Tillerson was chairman and CEO of ExxonMobil, one of the most powerful industry titans in the world.

Today, after being recruited to leave Exxon and join the government, he is being tweet-mocked by the president of the United States as "dumb as a rock."

text: Thanks, @peterbakernyt. You masterfully captured the whole soaring event and Bush’s place in history https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/05/us/politics/bush-funeral-national-cathedral.html …
author: PhilipRucker

text: At George H.W. Bush’s funeral, a magisterial presidency meets one diminished by division, @gregjaffe writes

text: A top White House appointee at the VA sought to silence the agency’s chief diversity officer who pushed after Charlottesville for a forceful condemnation of white nationalists — a @Reinlwapo scoop
author: PhilipRucker

text: Credit here goes to @AaronBlake, whose tweet planted the seed
author: PhilipRucker

text: The mourners did not deliver the searing rebukes of Trump the nation witnessed at John McCain’s funeral. But despite being crafted to honor Bush’s legacy, their words nevertheless also served to underscore the singular nature of Trump’s own presidency.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
NEW —> Trump sits with fellow presidents, but still stands alone. It was impossible for mourners to pay tribute to the 41st president without drawing implicit contrasts to the 45th. 

My latest on Bush’s funeral

https://wapo.st/2G1B1L9
author: PhilipRucker

text: Saudi-funded lobbyist paid for 500 rooms at Trump’s hotel after 2016 election, @Fahrenthold & @OConnellPostbiz report
author: PhilipRucker

text: “His life code was: Tell the truth. Don’t blame people. Be strong. Do your best. Try hard. Forgive. Stay the course. And that was, and is, the most American of creeds," @jmeacham says of Bush, as Trump looks on.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "To serve, he had to succeed. To preside he had to prevail. Politics, he once admitted, isn’t a pure undertaking -- not if you want to win," @jmeacham says of Bush.
author: PhilipRucker

text: “George Herbert Walker Bush was America’s last great soldier statesman, a 20th century founding father.” -- @jmeacham
author: PhilipRucker

text: After WW2, “The rest of his life was a perennial effort to prove himself worthy of his salvation," @jmeacham says
author: PhilipRucker

text: The differences between Trump and his predecessors are evident in ways big and small. 39, 42 and 44 are singing along to the hymn, but 45's lips are not moving.
author: PhilipRucker

text: George W. Bush and Laura Bush just greeted the Trumps and all the living former presidents and first ladies -- Obamas, Clintons and Carters. Donald Trump only greeted the Obamas.
author: PhilipRucker

text: President Trump traveled 250 yards to greet George W. Bush. Rather thank walk, he used a stretch limo and an eight-vehicle motorcade to make the trip, @DavidNakamura writes
author: PhilipRucker

text:
NEW —> Trump pulls punches at global summit, making nice with foes and avoiding feuds. 

My latest from Buenos Aires with @agearan & @Anthony_Faiola

text: Bush was in declining health and wasn’t getting out of bed earlier this week. But then Friday morning he ate a big breakfast of three eggs, yogurt and fruit juice. He was in good spirits and at peace the moment he died, @danbalz writes
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump praises George H.W. Bush and his legacy, putting aside past feud with family. My latest with @DavidNakamura
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump announces he is sending Air Force One to Houston to pick up the casket of President Bush and then bring him back to Washington. Trump calls that “a special tribute that he deserves very much. It’s my honor."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump at Xi dinner: “The relationship is very special, the relationship that I have with President Xi, and I think that is going to be a primary reason why we’ll probably end up getting something that will be good for China and good for the United States.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: “He kept his cool. He kept it because that is who he was, at the very core driven by his own personal code: prudence and stewardship. When the world blew up on his watch, Bush gripped the wheel, kept his eyes on the road and tried to avoid a wreck.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: “It was as gentle a passing as I think you could ever expect anyone to have. And he was ready” — Jim Baker talks to @peterbakernyt about Bush 41’s goodbye.
author: PhilipRucker

text: “The man who once sought to fashion himself as the younger, fresher face of Saudi leadership has also arrived to find himself viewed as tainted, transformed into a global symbol of brutal tyranny,” @Anthony_Faiola & @agearan write
author: PhilipRucker

author: PhilipRucker

text:
Just in: Trump spoke to Putin last night at G20 leaders dinner.

Statement from Sarah Sanders: "As is typical at multilateral events, President Trump and the First Lady had a number of informal conversations with world leaders at the dinner last night, including President Putin."
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump says he spoke to George W. Bush and Jeb Bush to express condolences. He also says the death of a president “puts a damper” on his high-stakes dinner tonight with President Xi.

The latest from Buenos Aires —>
author: PhilipRucker

text: Asked by the press pool whether he regrets his past comments about President George H.W. Bush, Trump declined to comment. “Thank you very much, everybody,” he said.
author: PhilipRucker

author: PhilipRucker

author: PhilipRucker

text: "I worked in George H.W. Bush’s press office. He was like a father to me.”

author: PhilipRucker

text: “That he was perceived as lacking in grit was another irony in the life of Mr. Bush. His was a character that had been forged by trial. He was an exemplary story of a generation whose youth was cut short by the Great Depression and World War II.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: “Although Mr. Bush served as president three decades ago, his values and ethic seem centuries removed from today’s acrid political culture. His currency of personal connection was the handwritten letter — not the social media blast.” — @ktumulty https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/george-hw-bush-41st-president-of-the-united-states-dies-at-94/2018/11/30/42fa2ea2-61e2-11e8-99d2-0d678ec08c2f_story.html …

text: Trump's omnipresence has frustrated Democrats, who are attempting to stay focused on their own messages. Pelosi told WaPo: "It’s really important not to take the bait from the president, with his scare-a-thon and his this-and-that."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump has never been hemmed in by fact or fairness. But at one mega-rally after another, he has taken his no-boundaries political ethos to a whole new level — demagoguing the Democrats in a whirl of distortion. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/full-trumpism-the-presidents-apocalyptic-attacks-reach-a-new-level-of-falsity/2018/11/04/8e4fb87e-e043-11e8-b759-3d88a5ce9e19_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.69789c63daff …

author: PhilipRucker

text: I’ve been to a #MAGA rally every night for the last five nights. I get why Trump thinks he’s hugely popular & his movement is history's biggest. There’s incredible energy & adulation out here. Trouble is, it’s just one part of America, and he doesn’t see the rest of the country.
author: PhilipRucker

text: It’s been said a million times, but here’s a million and one — Trump’s rallies are unlike anything else in politics. Currently, Rihanna’s “Don’t Stop the Music” is blaring in Chattanooga as aides toss free Trump T-shirts into the crowd, like a ball game. Everyone’s loving it.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Inside, meanwhile, the 11,000-seat McKenzie Arena already is full. Massive turnout in Chattanooga.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "This midterm election is like no other in a generation” — a must-read @danbalz table setter for Tuesday
author: PhilipRucker

text:

text: Trump Ag Secretary Sonny Perdue said at a rally today that DeSantis's race against Gillum, who is black, is "so cotton-pickin' important to the state of Florida."

text:
Trump suggests Democrats organized the Central American migrant caravan:

“They want to invite caravan after caravan, and it is a little suspicious how those caravans are started. I think it’s a good thing, maybe, that they did it. Did they energize our base or what?”
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump on Andrew Gillum, who is running to become Florida's first black governor: "Andrew Gillum is not equipped to be your governor. He’s just not equipped. It’s not for him. It’s not for him."

text:
Trump in Indianapolis emphasizes Obama’s middle name:

“No surprise that Joe Donnelly is holding a rally this weekend with Barack H. Obama.”

text: “Good genes in the Pence family, don’t they?” Trump remarks as he calls out Indiana congressional candidate Greg Pence, Mike’s brother.

text:
Legendary Indiana basketball coach Bobby Knight is on stage at Trump’s Indianapolis rally, leading crowd in chant of, “Go get ‘em, Donald!”

"He’s been a great defender for the United States of America,” Knight says of Trump.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
“I never left center stage,” Trump tells Indianapolis crowd. “You know what that means?”

He’s referring to his position in the 2015-16 GOP primary debates.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump in Indianapolis on Democrats: “I think they overplayed their hands on this one, folks, because between Justice Kavanaugh and the caravans, you people are energized!"

text: The famous Trump #MAGA rally mix has some relatively new additions: Village People's "YMCA" and "Macho Man," plus a dose of Michael Jackson. "Beat It" just played in Indy, and "We Are The World" played last night in Missouri.

text:
NEW —> Trump vows to end “crazy” birthright citizenship in closing midterms appeal. 

+ DeSantis says Gillum should be impeached. “Lock him up!”

+ Trump says media deserve “enemy of the people” label. 

+ more from a rollicking #MAGA rally in Florida..
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump tells @jonkarl caravan is larger than reported: “I’m pretty good at estimating crowd size. And I’ll tell you they look a lot bigger than people would think.”

Trump also says migrant women & children are purposefully posed for cameras. “Not good.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump: “Birthright citizenship, you know all about it, we will keep the criminals, the drug dealers, we will keep them all out of our country. We will get rid of all of this. We will end, finally, birthright citizenship.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: As Trump boasts about creating a sixth branch of the military — “Space Force!” — many in the crowd laugh, as if they’re in on a joke or something.
author: PhilipRucker

text: As expected, birthright citizenship has made its way into Trump’s closing argument stump speech. He called it a “crazy policy” and is speaking at length about “criminal aliens” and “illegal immigrant children.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: With Trump standing watch, DeSantis says, “Maybe we should impeach Gillum as mayor of Tallahassee” for corruption. Crowd chants, “Lock him Up!”
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Calling out local congressmen Francis Rooney and Matt Gaetz, Trump says nothing to praise their records on behalf of Florida, but rather cheers their defenses of him on cable TV.

“I love it when he defends me,” Trump says of Rooney. “He’s brutal. He gets the job done!”
author: PhilipRucker

text: Crowd cheers loudly when Trump says he intends to catch the Central American migrants in the caravan and not release them. “It’s called catch, but we take the word release out.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump calls next week’s midterms “one of the most important elections of our entire lives — though I will say, not as important as 2016!”
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump at Florida rally says: “33 percent of the people in this country believe the fake news is in fact — and I hate to say this — in fact the enemy of the people.”

Crowd of thousands on their feet roars.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Aww! You can tell her he’s slowly losing his hearing at a #MAGA rally in Florida. “YMCA” and “Macho Man” are on repeat, awaiting Trump.

text: Republicans are openly fretting about losing the Senate majority, a prospect that once seemed unlikely, because of Trump’s unpopularity and some lackluster candidates, @WaPoSean reports
author: PhilipRucker

text: Paul Manafort, convicted ex-Trump campaign chairman, is in talks with feds about a plea deal, @thamburger, @DevlinBarrett & @hsu_spencer report
author: PhilipRucker

text:
“Tremendously big”

“Tremendously wet”

Trump the showman reaches for superlatives in the face of calamity, @AshleyRParker reports
author: PhilipRucker

text: I can totally picture @llerer asking @CynthiaNixon about bagel-gate. Lisa has a fresh eye on politics, and isn't afraid to have a little fun. Her newsletter will be a must-read
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump on Gary Cohn and Rob Porter statements re Woodward book: "I really appreciate their statement. Their statement was excellent."
author: PhilipRucker

text:
"I think Puerto Rico was an incredible, unsung success. Texas we've been given A-pluses for. Florida we've been given A-pluses for" -- Trump on his handling of 2017 hurricanes.

Reminder: Roughly 3,000 people died in Puerto Rico from storm and its aftermath.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "This is going to be a storm that's a very large one, far larger than we've seen in decades," Trump says of Hurricane Florence.
author: PhilipRucker

text: "This field is now a monument to American defiance. This memorial is now a message to the world: 'America will never, ever submit to tyranny.'" -- President Trump in Shanksville, Pa.

text:

My latest with @AshleyRParker on what this past week tells us about the midterms. (Hint: It’s all about T-R-U-M-P.)

text: NFL fans have a message for Trump: Enough already. @wpjenna was at the Philadelphia Eagles home opener and fans said they’re tired of the political division over NFL protests.

text:
‘I Don’t Talk’ That Way, Trump Says. Except When He Does.

Good @peterbakernyt & @maggieNYT piece recounting Trump's history of calling people "mentally retarded" and "dumb Southerners"

author: PhilipRucker

text:
At dinner with Mattis and Dunford, Trump falsely suggested that John McCain had been a coward for taking early release from a prisoner-of-war camp in Vietnam because of his father’s military rank and leaving others behind.

Mattis has to correct him.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Woodward writes that Trump told Mattis he wanted to assassinate Assad: “Let’s fucking kill him! Let’s go in. Let’s kill the fucking lot of them.” 

Mattis hung up the phone and told senior aide, “We’re not going to do any of that.”

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/bob-woodwards-new-book-reveals-a-nervous-breakdown-of-trumps-presidency/2018/09/04/b27a389e-ac60-11e8-a8d7-0f63ab8b1370_story.html …
author: PhilipRucker

text: Incredible Woodward details. Among them, Gary Cohn wrote a resignation letter after Charlottesville, but stayed on. Kelly told him, "I would have taken that resignation letter and shoved it up his ass six different times." https://wapo.st/2NMQldI
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump said of AG Jeff Sessions, per Woodward: “This guy is mentally retarded. He’s this dumb Southerner. … He couldn’t even be a one-person country lawyer down in Alabama.” https://wapo.st/2NMQldI
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump told Wilbur Ross: “I don’t trust you. I don’t want you doing any more negotiations. … You’re past your prime.” https://wapo.st/2NMQldI

text: Trump was absent and his name never invoked, but the entire memorial service for John McCain was animated by a sustained rebellion against the president’s worldview and his singular brand of politics https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/mccains-funeral-was-a-melancholy-last-hurrah-for-whats-been-lost-in-trump-era/2018/09/01/156784c6-ad46-11e8-b1da-ff7faa680710_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.d1325f3a58e3 …

text: Obama, in McCain eulogy, condemns today's politics that are "mean" and "petty," and based on "bombast, insult, phony controversies and manufactured outrage." This politics, he says, "pretends to be brave and tough, but in fact is born in fear."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Some apparent shade from a longtime Trump spokeswoman at John McCain, who ran for president twice
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump is truly upstaged today. He is tweeting NAFTA threats, but cable news is not cutting in with bulletins. Coverage is squarely on Henry Kissinger eulogizing John McCain right now.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Midway through Meghan McCain's eulogy, President Trump loaded into his motorcade and has left the White House. Destination unknown. He was wearing a white MAGA hat, per press pool. Golf?
author: PhilipRucker

text: History will remember @MeghanMcCain's eulogy. Wow.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Sustained applause throughout National Cathedral for @MeghanMcCain as she says: "The America of John McCain has no need to be made great again because America was always great.”
author: PhilipRucker

text: As she delivers a moving tribute to her father, @MeghanMcCain is incredibly composed and powerful.
author: PhilipRucker

text: TV just showed Gabby Giffords reading the program at McCain's funeral, a reminder of how extraordinary her recovery has been since the 2011 assassination attempt.
author: PhilipRucker

text: As Senator McCain's casket arrived at the National Cathedral and Presidents Obama and Bush took their seats before delivering eulogies, President Trump, at home on a dreary morning, raged about the "Fake Dossier" in a tweet in which he misspelled Obama's name.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Lots of Trump admin officials spotted at McCain funeral, including:
-John Kelly
-Jim Mattis

text: Literally every Washington power player -- Democratic and Republican, past and present -- is at McCain's funeral, except the sitting president, who is tweeting his grievances about the DOJ and FBI.

text:
Trump has tried to discredit Mueller, discredit Sessions and defend Manafort. 

But our poll found it isn’t working. 63 percent support Mueller investigation. 64 percent say Sessions shouldn’t be fired. 67 percent say case against Manafort was justified.

text: In Iowa three years ago, after Trump said McCain wasn’t a war hero because he was captured, Trump told reporters he got out of serving in Vietnam because of a bone spur. But he couldn’t remember which foot had been injured.

text: Brennan responds —>
author: PhilipRucker

text:
John Brennan's public service:
-CIA station chief in Saudi Arabia
-CIA chief of staff
-Director of Terrorist Threat Integration Center
-Director of National Counter terrorism Center
-White House Homeland Security Adviser
-CIA director
-Briefed three presidents
author: PhilipRucker

text: Former CIA director John Brennan, whose security clearance Trump is revoking today, was on MSNBC last night and on Twitter saying Trump fails to live up to minimum standards of decency and does not understand what it takes to be an honest person.
author: PhilipRucker

text: As Trump retaliates against political critics by revoking or reviewing their security clearances, it is worth remembering that the president himself revealed highly classified information to Russians in an Oval Office meeting.
author: PhilipRucker

text:
Trump also is reviewing security clearances of James Clapper, James Comey, Michael Hayden, Sally Yates, Susan Rice, Andrew McCabe, Peter Strzok and Lisa Page. 

What do they have in common? They're political critics of Trump. Looks like a Trump blacklist.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump is revoking former CIA director John Brennan's security clearance because of "erratic behavior," according to Sarah Sanders. Brennan has been sharply critical of Trump's presidency on television.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump: “To be a strong nation, we have to have these strong borders. We cannot send our military to confront threats abroad, only to allow those same threats to cross our borders and to threaten us right here at home."

text:
Missouri Senate candidate Josh Hawley at VFW Convention: “You know, when I think about President Trump, there’s one word that comes to mind. That word is courage.”

text: President Trump has arrived at the Finnish Presidential Palace in Helsinki for his summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin. After ceremonial beginning, the agenda calls for 90 minutes of Trump and Putin, one-on-one, with only interpreters at their side.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Trump is en route to the Presidential Palace on Helsinki’s waterfront to meet Putin. As pooler @anniekarni notes, "The notoriously late Russian President Vladimir Putin kept POTUS cooling his heels in his guest house for close to an hour past his planned departure time."
author: PhilipRucker

text: Summit was set to begin 11 minutes ago, but leaders are not at the palace yet. It appears Putin is holding up Trump. Keeping people waiting is the Russian president’s MO to assert dominance.

text: The Marina Bay Sands, which Kim Jong Un just toured, is a Sheldon Adelson palace of the kind of wealth, glitz and glamour (roof bars, infinity pools and, yes, a giant Louis Vuitton store lit up over the harbor) that he could only dream of building in Pyongyang.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Curious what Trump thinks if he’s watching TV from his hotel because Kim Jong Un is basking in the global media spotlight with a moonlit stroll along Singapore’s waterfront.
author: PhilipRucker

text: Fascinating night in Singapore. Kim Jong Un, isolated no more, has stolen the pre-show with Trumpian theatrics. He’s toured the gleaming Marina Bay Sands and waterfront sights, soaking in the kind of prosperity he hopes normalized relations with US could bring to Pyongyang.
author: PhilipRucker
